description:
Re configuration of existing use classes within the site, including change of use to Nos. 30-31 second and third floor from C3 residential to B1 office use and change of use of rear B1 office unit to C3 residential, and the following associated works: 
1) Demolition of 2 storey workshop building to the rear of Nos. 30-31 
2) Erection of a new 5 storey mixed use building with residential (C3) use above and restaurant (A3) at ground to the rear of the site 
3) Lowering and enlargement of the existing basement to no.32 
4) New enlarged lightwell with two and a half storey stone colonnade from basement to ground floor mezzanine level at the rear of Nos. 30-31 
5) 1st floor rear extension to No.30-31 with green roof 
6) New double pitched mansard roof including reinstated brick chimney to no.32 at 4th floor level to house plant equipment 
7) Erection of a rear extension at 3rd floor level to No.32 to alterations to accommodate internal layout 
8) Erection of a new enlarged replacement mansard roof and dormer windows to Nos. 30-31 to replace existing. 
9) Internal re configuration of both Nos. 30-31 and No. 32 to provide an internal connection at first, second and third floor level 
10) New stair, lift core and services arrangement to No. 32 
11) Installation of new opaque window to the rear elevation of No. 32 at ground floor level 
12) Refurbishment of all existing windows and repointing where required to existing brickwork 
13) Refurbishment of existing shopfronts at Nos. 30-31 and No. 32 and new solid timber door to residential entrance at Nos. 30-31.
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed new five storey building to the rear of the site by reason of its excessive height, scale, massing, form, bulk and inappropriate and contrived detailed design, is considered to form a discordant and dominant form of development that would result in an incongruous backland addition that fails to appear subservient to and causes harm to the locally listed buildings at no's.30-31 and 32 Clerkenwell Green, and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Clerkenwell Green Conservation Area. In addition, the proposed first floor rear extension to no's.30-31 Clerkenwell Green due to its full width, excessive depth from the rear elevation and proximity to the proposed new five storey building further exacerbates the overly cramped and excessively dominant nature of the proposals which would appear unduly overbearing when seen within their context. The proposal is therefore unacceptable, contrary to Policies 7.4 & 7.8 of the London Plan (2016), policies CS8 and CS9 of the Islington Core Strategy (2011), policies DM2.1 and DM2.3 of the Islington Development Management Policies (2013) and the Urban Design Guide 2017, Clerkenwell Green Conservation Area Design Guidelines.
